text: Henry Mason (June 19, 1931 â€“ May 29, 2020) was an American professional baseball player. He played as a relief pitcher with the 1958 and 1960 Philadelphia Phillies of Major League Baseball. He began his career with the Kansas City Monarchs of the Negro American League. He was a starting pitcher in the 1954 East-West Game. Mason was born in Marshall, Missouri. Mason died on May 29, 2020 in Richmond, Virginia at the age of 88. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:African-American baseball players Category:Philadelphia Phillies players Category:Sportspeople from Missouri
title: Hank Mason
